job_titles: MBO/HBO work along Internship IT Communication and Community management
job_description:
Are you up for a challenge?
Then help us activate and grow our Ambassador community for the digital workplace at ING! Our ambassadors are voluntary employees throughout the ING organisation in the Netherlands and is a growing community in other countries where ING is stationed.
The ambition and purpose of these ambassadors is to help their colleagues use the continuously changing digital workplace to the max by giving tips how to work smarter and optimise collaboration. We feed them with knowledge through training, events, and continuous sharing on the online community.
Who are we? We are Workplace Services: the department that’s responsible for the delivery of IT-related workplace products and services to ING colleagues worldwide. Think computers, Wi-Fi, software, telephones, and of course the support for all of these.
Are we looking for you?
We are looking for an online community ‘animal’ who loves to provide continuous support and inspiration on the online community and who is creative in trying out new ways to help activate and involve our ambassadors. Are you that proactive online communications trainee who wants to learn the ropes in a diverse and dynamic setting?
If so, you will be part of our small Ambassadors programme team for at least five to six months, starting in May 2023. You will be in charge of maintaining and activating the online ambassador community by: sharing knowledge and tips which will be provided to you; looking for inspiration and examples online how ambassadors can improve their knowledge sharing; checking for good examples within the community and help this ambassador to share their insights with other ambassadors; helping with organising the monthly global ambassador session and once a year a global event. There will be lots of space to try out new ideas and grow this community both in enthusiasm and numbers. Workplace Services is a uniquely pivotal ING department where no day is the same.
What you’ll be doing
Watch over the online ambassador community and collect answers to support the ambassadors.
Stroll the internet for interesting articles, documents, and examples how ambassadors can share their knowledge proactively with their colleagues.
Create new initiatives to keep the ambassadors involved and enthusiastic and have them share their experiences with the other ambassadors.
Perform on goings tasks on a weekly base like onboarding new ambassadors, giving them access to our ambassador community and SharePoint site, sending out the welcome mail.
Help organising online and off-line events for the ambassadors to share knowledge and experiences.
Write a newsletter for the ambassador community every month.
Help promoting the ambassador programme in the other ING countries.
Your profile
You are an MBO or HBO student in the field of journalism, communications, languages or related studies.
You love to manage the online communities You have affinity with IT and the latest (cross media) technologies.
You are independent, ambitious, and result driven.
You are pragmatic, proactive, and you enjoy coming up with new ideas.
You work in an accurate and structured manner.
You are an enthusiastic team player.
You are fluent in both English and Dutch.
You study and live in the Netherlands.
What we offer
32 hours/week internship for five to six months.
You will be part of a small enthusiastic and dedicated team.
A dynamic, international environment where you can learn at a fast pace.
A great chance to develop yourself as an online community manager and learn about internal communications at a high level.
Internship allowance.

job_titles: Work along internship: Communications and User adoption of the Microsoft 365 services
job_description:
Are you up for a challenge? Help us get our internal communications about the ING Digital Workplace future-proof!
Our challenges: product introductions & user adoption of tools
An important task for Workplace Service is the introduction of new digital workplace tools & features and migrating our services to new, improved versions for all global ING colleagues. We are looking for an intern who can help us set up end user friendly communications for these migrations and introductions.
We also help our global colleagues to optimise their way of working with the (Microsoft 365) tools. One way to do this is to create snackable, short content to get their interest.
During your internship you’ll help us create newsletters, online news items on our SharePoint site(s) and other content. You’ll also create emails, write articles for the ING intranet, develop visual aids (such as quick start guides and OnePagers) and you’ll manage our ‘My Workplace community’ on Yammer.
Who are we?
We are Workplace Services (WPS): the department that’s responsible for the delivery of IT-related workplace products and services to 54.000 ING colleagues in 40 countries. Think computers, Wi-Fi, software, telephones, and of course the support for all of these.
Are we looking for you?
We are looking for a communications intern:
with knowledge about how to set up and manage an online community;
who knows that structure is as important as content;
who is creative in finding out and testing new ways to help activate and engage our colleagues;
who likes to think about the best way to get a message across and who likes to write (and visualise) fun, short and desirable content.
Are you that proactive marketing or communications intern who wants to learn the ropes in a diverse and dynamic setting?
If so, you will be part of our Workplace Services team for at least four to six months, starting in May 2023.
There will be lots of opportunities to try out new ideas! You will help improve our end user communications and make our channels and activities future-proof. Workplace Services is a uniquely pivotal ING department where no day is the same.
Examples of what you would be doing
Improve engagement for the My Workplace community on Yammer. Stimulate colleagues to use Yammer and come up with ideas to make the community grow.
Write and create the New Digital Workplace newsletter in which new tools and features are introduced.
Create weekly news items for our SharePoint HUB site. This can be in text, video or images.
Help develop emails, user instructions and knowledge articles for new tools and services.
Share any other ideas on how we could use modern channels to improve our end user communications!
Your profile
You are a bachelor or master student in the field of communications, languages, marketing or related studies.
You live in The Netherlands.
You know how to write attractive and understandable content about sometimes complicated (technical) topics.
You have affinity with IT and the latest (cross media) technologies.
You are independent, ambitious and result-driven.
You are pragmatic, proactive, and you enjoy coming up with new ideas.
You work in an accurate and structured manner.
You are an enthusiastic team player.
You have a strong knowledge and experience with InDesign and Illustrator.
You are fluent in English. Dutch and or French is a pre.
What we offer
A 32-hours per week internship for three to six months.
You will be part of a small enthusiastic and dedicated team.
A dynamic, international environment where you can learn at a fast pace.
A great chance to develop yourself as an online community manager and adoption expert and learn about internal communications at a high level.
Internship allowance and travel compensation.

job_titles: Expert toezicht op operationele & IT-risico's bij pensioenfondsen en verzekeraars
job_description:
Bachelor, Master
32-36 uur
Niet-financieel risicomanagement
Werkervaring: Professional
€ 5.030 - € 7.830 bruto p.m.
Reageer uiterlijk 19 april 2023
Je houdt toezicht op dit complexe speelveld als expert toezicht operationele & IT-risico’s bij DNB.
Jij hebt impact
Bij DNB werk je met impact op financiële stabiliteit en duurzame welvaart. Met een vermogen van miljarden pensioengelden en de verantwoordelijkheid voor miljoenen verzekerden zijn verzekeraars en pensioenfondsen belangrijke spelers op de financiële markt. Tegelijkertijd staan beide sectoren voor grote uitdagingen, mede gedreven door de ontwikkelingen die gaan over de operationele implementatie van het pensioenakkoord, cybersecurity, impact en beheersing van grote uitbestedingspartijen zoals BigTechs. Ook kom je in aanraking met interne controle raamwerken van instellingen, soms ondersteund door Artificial Intelligence. Jij bent als expert operational & IT-risk betrokken bij de beoordeling van allerlei vraagstukken op dit gebied. Aan jou de opdracht om in dit complexe speelveld toezicht te houden!
Zo doe je dat als expert toezicht operationele & IT-risico’s bij DNB
Je onderzoekt hoe pensioenfondsen en verzekeraars hun operationele en IT-risico’s beheersen. Recent is onze toezichtsmethodologie geactualiseerd, waarbij we risicogebaseerd en data-gedreven onze inzet bepalen op die instellingen waar aandacht ook echt nodig is. Met beoordelingskaders onderzoek je huidige risico’s en identificeer je nieuwe risico’s. De onderzoeken variëren in intensiteit en duur. Je beoordeelt rapportages, je voert data-analyses uit en je interviewt bestuurders, directie, management en specialisten van onder toezicht staande instellingen. Soms in risico-identificerende gesprekken, soms in gerichte onderzoeken van een paar dagen tot meerdere weken.
Daarnaast werk je mee aan deze vorm van toezicht in Europees verband, door kennisdeling met andere toezichthouders. De komst van de ‘Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA)’ versterkt deze samenwerking. We zetten je in op uiteenlopende, sector-overschrijdende themaonderzoeken en projecten. De onderzoeken variëren in intensiteit en duur. Afhankelijk van je ervaring houd je toezicht op één of meerdere instellingen tegelijkertijd.
Wat ga je nog meer doen?
Je adviseert als expert de account toezichthouders en de directie van DNB over de operationele en IT-risico’s en de gewenste follow-up die nodig is.
Je onderhoudt interne en externe contacten en zorgt voor uitwisseling op je vakgebied. Dit doe je door gesprekken met specialisten in de sector maar ook door middel van het spreken op seminars.
Je werkt mee aan het opstellen van eigen normenkaders waarbij afstemming wordt gezocht met verschillende interne en externe stakeholders waaronder ministeries en koepelorganisaties.
Door onderzoeken te doen bij nationale en internationale instellingen en gerichte opleidingen te volgen, blijf je op de hoogte van nieuwe (technologische) ontwikkelingen op ons vakgebied.
Je hebt een prominente rol in kennisdeling binnen het team en binnen het uitvoerend toezicht op jouw vakgebied. Afhankelijk van je ervaring begeleid je junior collega’s binnen het team.
Je ondersteunt in onze interne digitaliseringsambitie, waarbij we ons richten op het ontwikkelen en beheren van risicoscoremodellen, inzetten van nieuwe innovatieve technologieën (denk aan Natural Language Processing of process mining/data-analyses) of inzet in pilots op het gebied van digitalisering.
Hier doe je dat
Je werkt als expert operational & IT-risk bij het Expertisecentrum Operationele & IT-risico’s, verantwoordelijk voor het in kaart brengen van de operationele & IT-risico’s bij pensioeninstellingen en verzekeraars. We houden nieuwe ontwikkelingen op ons vakgebied nauwgezet bij en we vertalen deze naar diverse toezichtthema’s. Je collega’s zijn 15 hoogopgeleide professionals en we hebben een sterke groeiambitie binnen DNB. De sfeer is informeel en collegiaal. We investeren veel in opleiding van kennis en ontwikkelingen in de sector. Wij zorgen voor ‘training on the job’ en onze beoordelingskaders, case studies en eerdere beoordelingen geven je de kans het vak van toezichthouder eigen te maken. Een goede samenwerking met je team en andere afdelingen binnen en buiten de divisie is daarbij cruciaal.
Bij DNB werken we hybride. Ons kantoor in Amsterdam is onze thuisbasis, de plek waar we elkaar ontmoeten, waar we met elkaar kennis delen en (samen)werken. Tegelijkertijd is er ook voldoende ruimte om een werkplek en -tijd te kiezen waar we ons werk het beste kunnen doen en waar we zo veel mogelijk waarde kunnen toevoegen. En natuurlijk zorgen we dat je ook thuis uitstekend kunt werken met laptop, telefoon en een goede thuiswerkplekinrichting.
Dit breng je mee
Bij DNB werk je met inhoudelijke professionals. De kwaliteit van het werk van je collega’s is hoog. Daarom vinden we het belangrijk dat jij flexibel, zelfstandig en proactief bent. Je bent nieuwsgierig, kritisch en onderzoekend. Je bent sterk en zuiver in je mening- en oordeelsvorming, ook onder hoge druk. Je beschikt over helikopterview, bent analytisch sterk en in staat om snel dwarsverbanden te leggen. Uit grote hoeveelheden informatie weet je snel tot de essentie van een probleem te komen.
Je bent ervaren in het uitvoeren van meerdere onderzoeken tegelijkertijd waarbij voor jou geldt: hard op de inhoud en zacht op de relatie. Je bent in staat de bestuurs- en directieleden van de instellingen te challengen en waar nodig met behulp van verschillende stijlen te overtuigen van jouw standpunt.
Waar zijn we verder nog naar op zoek?
Je hebt een academische master in een bedrijfskundige of informatietechnische richting. Een afgeronde opleiding RE/RA/RO (of equivalent daarvan) is hierbij een pre.
Je hebt aantoonbare affiniteit met operationele en/of IT-risico’s alsmede met digitalisering.
Je hebt minimaal acht jaar ervaring bijvoorbeeld in de financiële dienstverlening, consultancy of accountancy.
Een stevige persoonlijkheid die zich op haar of zijn gemak voelt in gesprekken op bestuursniveau binnen organisaties en hierbij weet om te gaan met weerstanden.
Een goed oog voor teamdynamiek en affiniteit met coaching van minder ervaren medewerkers.
Jouw communicatieve vaardigheden zijn uitstekend, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk en zowel in het Nederlands als in het Engels.

Meer weten? Lees ook de testimonial van onze collega Sander op onze werkenbij-pagina.
Dit bieden we je
Een 36-urige werkweek met werk midden in de financiële en economische actualiteit. Bij een betrouwbare en maatschappelijk betrokken werkgever in Amsterdam, die voortdurend inspeelt op de veranderende eisen van onze omgeving. En die doorlopend innoveert. We staan als instelling midden in de samenleving. Onze mensen zijn gedreven en betrokken bij hun werk binnen een maatschappelijke context. Wij zien een diverse en inclusieve werkomgeving als één van de voorwaarden om als organisatie succesvol te zijn en onze doelstellingen te blijven bereiken. Benieuwd hoe wij dat doen en wat onze collega’s hiervan vinden? Lees en bekijk hier meer.
Dit biedt jou volop kansen je verder te verdiepen en nieuwe ervaringen op te doen. In Nederland, maar ook daarbuiten. Je start met een jaarcontract, bij goed functioneren en wanneer de (organisatorische) omstandigheden niet wijzigen is er uitzicht op voortzetting.
De overige goede arbeidsvoorwaarden die horen bij deze functie:
Een salaris van minimaal € 5.030,- en maximaal € 7.830,- bruto per maand, op basis van een 36-urige werkweek. De uiteindelijke inschaling is onder meer afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring.
Een 13de maand, 8% vakantietoeslag berekend over 13 maanden en een vrij besteedbaar persoonlijk budget van 5,9% van je 12-maandssalaris.
Pensioenopbouw op basis van middelloon met voorwaardelijke indexatie. Eigen bijdrage in de premie 6,68%.
Een volledige vergoeding van je OV-reiskosten woon-werkverkeer.
Veel mogelijkheden jezelf door opleiding en training zowel vakinhoudelijk als persoonlijk te blijven ontwikkelen.
Een goede balans tussen je professionele en je privéleven. In deze functie is het mogelijk om 4 dagen van 9 uur te werken.

job_titles: Credit risk expert in on-site banking supervision
job_description:
Master
36 uur
Financieel risicomanagement
Werkervaring: Professional
€ 3.480 - € 6.650 bruto p.m.
Reageer uiterlijk 25 april 2023
Unique and challenging position for a credit risk expert in on-site banking supervision at DNB.
Jij hebt impact
Make an impact!
Working at DNB, you will have direct impact on financial stability and sustainable prosperity. As a credit risk expert you help achieve these goals by participating in targeted on-site inspections at banks and providing expertise to colleagues.
You will supervise all aspects of the credit risk process, from origination to monitoring to provisioning, and for a wide range of assets; from mortgages and SME loans to complex corporate financing structures. Your expertise helps to ensure that banks are safe and sound and can continue to support households, businesses and projects through their lending. In other words, you will have a direct impact on society!
This is what you will be doing as a credit risk expert at DNB
You will conduct inspections on the set-up and practical effectiveness of credit risk management in specific portfolios of Dutch and international banks. You conduct these inspections on-site, at the banks’ premises, as well as in a more hybrid form.
Key issues that will require attention in the period ahead are the determination of provisioning in line with new international accounting standards (IFRS9), the increasing use of complex algorithms in credit models, and the impact of geopolitical challenges, inflationary pressures and climate risks on the quality of credit portfolios.
This is what your job involves:
Assessing the management of credit risks at banks during inspections based on interviews, quantitative risk analyses, policy reviews and individual credit files. You will share your observations with the relevant account supervisors and advise them on the appropriate supervisory strategy.
Conducting complex, in-depth quantitative analyses, contributing to benchmarking studies, developing analytical tooling and research methods, at DNB as well as in international working groups.
Advising DNB's account supervisors, SSM supervisors and DNB's Executive Board on credit risk-related matters and the necessary follow-up.
Sharing your knowledge and observations with your DNB and SSM colleagues, to improve the effectiveness of Dutch and European credit risk supervision.
Hier doe je dat
This is where you will be working
You will work in a team of 14 colleagues within the Credit Risk (CR) department. CR is part of the On-Site Supervision and Banking Expertise (OSBE) Division, which carries out inspections and supports other banking supervision divisions with its expertise. The OSBE Division employs around 100 committed professionals with various backgrounds and nationalities.
The inspections that you will be involved in are project-based. The project teams are of varying composition, comprising DNB colleagues and other supervisors within the European Single Supervisory Mechanism (SSM).
DNB forms part of the SSM of the ECB and the national competent authorities of the 20 euro area countries. Working for the SSM means that you will have the opportunity to travel abroad for training, on-site inspections and other activities from time to time.
Dit breng je mee
What do we need from you?
At DNB you will work with other experts of a high professional standard. Against this background, we are looking for candidates with strong problem-solving and analytical skills and sharp judgment. Your analyses demonstrate a keen awareness of both current and emerging risks.
You have proven affinity with data and complex quantitative analyses. You enjoy a ‘hands-on’ approach towards challenging a bank’s reporting, models and risk assumptions.
You always remain critical, continue to ask questions and are able to hold your ground in difficult discussions.
You are able to articulate your observations and opinions in a clear, well-argumented and transparent manner.
You are excited to contribute to financial stability and sustainable prosperity.
Last but not least, you are a team player and you are willing to contribute to a positive working atmosphere in the department.

What other characteristics are we looking for?
You have a university Master's degree in econometrics, finance, risk management, business administration, accountancy or another field with a strong analytical and quantitative component.
You have at least 3-5 years of experience in credit risk management at a bank, supervisory authority or credit risk consultancy firm.
You have experience with the development or assessment of models, stress testing, statistical analysis, scenario planning and/or dashboard development. You are proficient with programming languages such as R and Python.
Prior experience with model-based (IRB/IFRS9/Stress testing) aspects of credit risk at a bank, supervisory authority or credit risk consultancy firm is considered a strong asset.
You have knowledge of relevant prudential laws and regulations, such as CRR/CRD and relevant EBA Guidelines. This includes the translation of credit risk into capital requirements.
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and (willingness to learn) Dutch. A good command of one or more other European languages is considered an asset.
You have no objection to travelling to other SSM member states from time to time.
Dit bieden we je
This is what we offer you
A 36-hour working week right at the heart of today's financial and economic current events. With a reliable and socially involved employer in Amsterdam, who constantly responds to the changing requirements of our environment. And that continuously innovates. As an institution, we are at the heart of society. Our people are driven and involved in their work within a social context. We see a diverse and inclusive work environment as one of the conditions for being successful as an organization and continuing to achieve our goals. Wondering how we do it and what our colleagues think about it? Read and watch more here.
This will offer you a wealth of opportunities to develop and gain new experiences, both in the Netherlands and abroad. You will initially be working on a one-year contract, with the prospect of an extension, provided you have performed well and our organisation has not undergone any changes that affect your job.
The other excellent terms and conditions of employment for this position are:
A salary of at least € 3.480.- and a maximum of € 6.650.- gross per month, based on a 36-hour working week. Among other things, the final salary will depend on your expertise and experience.
A 13th monthly salary, an 8% holiday allowance calculated on your 13-months’ salary and a freely disposable personal budget of 5.9% of your 12-months’ salary.
Your pension entitlements will accrue under a career-average scheme including provisional indexation, with a 6.54% employee contribution.
Full reimbursement of your public transport commute.
Plenty of opportunities for professional and personal development through education and training.
A healthy work-life balance. In this position, it is possible to divide your working week into 4 9-hour days.

job_titles: Associate Sector Banker Business Banking NL (Amsterdam)
job_description:
Associate Sector Banking ING Business Banking (Amsterdam)
Learn everything about banking for Business Banking customers and grow within ING
As an Associate Sector Banking you work in a responsible position in which you quickly learn everything about banking for business banking clients and with the opportunity to grow with an affinity for sector knowledge to a customer-oriented position within corporate ING.
You are the mainstay of 3 Sector Bankers. As sector specialists, these Sector Bankers advise colleagues and corporate clients, provide relevant information about the sector based on analysis and are the figurehead of Sector Banking ING business banking in the market. You support the Sector Bankers in the broadest sense, so that they always deliver maximum added value to customers and further expand the success of Sector Banking in their sector. For example, you conduct sector research, analyze studies and ensure that information becomes concretely applicable to customers. But you also help prepare internal and external customer interviews, facilitate knowledge meetings for entrepreneurs and create visibility for the Sector Bankers in the (social) media.
Do you have specific qualities in a certain area? For example as a web publisher, UX designer, communication specialist or as a data analyst? We are happy to give you all the space you need to make maximum use of your knowledge and skills, also within the other of the 9 main sectors in total that we distinguish.
Your work environment
As an Associate Sector Banking you work with approximately 15 colleagues within the Center of Expertise (CoE) of Sector Banking ING business banking in Amsterdam. You report to the Lead Sector Banking.
ING business banking works for customers in the business segment ranging from standard to complex product needs. Working at ING business banking means working in a culture in which taking final responsibility, working together in multidisciplinary teams, trusting your colleagues and team interests above self-interest are central. We provide the very best service, always aiming to exceed our customers' expectations.
Development and growth
Within ING we realize that we must always ensure that we have the best people in the right place for qualitative growth. That is why we invest in your personal growth and development. But we also expect you to take the initiative yourself and to always keep yourself informed of current developments within your field and to keep improving yourself.
We are looking for: studious, market-oriented and ambitious Associate Sector Banking
You really like a career at an innovative bank. And you have the ambition to grow into a customer-oriented role for (large) business customers. You therefore want nothing more than to get to know new facets of the banking profession every day and develop yourself further into a business expert. You also have the personality and skills to realize this ambition. You can organize well, you are sharply analytical, you think market-oriented and you easily connect with very diverse parties and at all levels. You are also good at working together, very strong in communication and you are firmly in your shoes under all circumstances.
In addition:
Do you have a completed education at HBO or WO level, for example Business Administration, Business Economics, Computer Science or Law;
Have you just graduated, a trainee or do you have work experience within the focus area.
You have an excellent command of the Dutch and English language, both orally and in writing.
You also endorse the values of ING, you consider it self-evident to act in accordance with these values in your work and, like all ING employees, you are prepared to take the banker's oath. For more information, see http://www.ing.jobs/Nederland/Over-ING/Ook-dit-is-ING/ING-Waarden.htm
Rewards & benefits
We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions here.
The benefits of working with us at ING include:
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
27 vacation days (40 work hours/week)
Pension scheme
13th month salary
Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
8% Holiday payment
Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster
Want to know more or apply?
Do you recognize yourself in this profile? Then apply now and become an Associate Sector Banking at ING business banking! Do you have any questions about this position or about ING as an employer? Please contact recruiter Anna.Nagy@ing.com,
We look forward to meeting you!
Associate Sector Banking ING Business Banking (Amsterdam)
Alles leren over bankieren voor grootzakelijke klanten en doorgroeien binnen ING
Als Associate Sector Banker werk je in een verantwoordelijke functie waarin je snel alles leert over bankieren voor grootzakelijke klanten en met de mogelijkheid om met affiniteit voor sectorkennis door te groeien naar een klantgerichte functie binnen zakelijk ING.
Je bent de steun en toeverlaat van 3 Sector Bankers. Deze Sector Bankers geven als sectorspecialist advies aan collega’s en aan grootzakelijke klanten, verstrekken op basis van analyse relevante informatie over de sector en zijn het boegbeeld van Sector Banking ING Grootzakelijk in de markt. Jij ondersteunt de Sector Bankers in de breedste zin, zodat zij altijd maximale toegevoegde waarde aan klanten leveren en het succes van Sector Banking in hun sector verder uitbouwen. Zo verricht je sectoronderzoek, analyseer je onderzoeken en zorg je dat informatie concreet toepasbaar wordt voor klanten. Maar je helpt ook bij het voorbereiden van in- en externe klantgesprekken, bij het faciliteren van kennisbijeenkomsten voor ondernemers en bij het creëren van zichtbaarheid voor de Sector Bankers in de (sociale) media.
Heb je zelf specifieke kwaliteiten op een bepaald gebied? Bijvoorbeeld als web-publisher, UX-ontwerper, communicatiespecialist of als data-analist? We geven je graag alle ruimte om je kennis en vaardigheden maximaal in te zetten, ook binnen de andere van de in totaal 7 sectoren die we onderscheiden.
Jouw werkomgeving
Als Associate Sector Banker werk je met circa 15 collega’s binnen het Center of Expertise (CoE) van Sector Banking ING Grootzakelijk in Amsterdam. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Sector Banking.
ING Grootzakelijk werkt voor klanten aan de bovenkant van het zakelijk segment met een complexe productbehoefte. Werken binnen ING Grootzakelijk betekent werken in een cultuur waarin het nemen van eindverantwoordelijkheid, het samenwerken in multidisciplinaire teams, vertrouwen op je collega’s en teambelang boven eigenbelang centraal staan. We leveren de allerbeste dienstverlening, waarbij het doel steeds is de verwachtingen van onze klanten te overtreffen.
Ontwikkeling en doorgroei
Binnen ING realiseren we ons dat we voor kwalitatieve groei steeds moeten zorgen dat we de beste mensen op de juiste plek hebben. Daarom investeren we in jouw persoonlijke doorgroei en ontwikkeling. Maar we verwachten ook dat je hierin zelf initiatief neemt en jezelf altijd op de hoogte houdt van actuele ontwikkelingen binnen je vakgebied en jezelf blijft verbeteren.
Interessant arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket
In deze fulltime functie (40 uur) heb je niet alleen een uitstekend salaris (afhankelijk van je werkervaring) en recht op 27 vakantiedagen, maar heb je ook een 13e maand.
Wij zoeken: leergierige, marktgerichte en ambitieuze Associate Sector Bankers
Je ziet een carrière bij een innovatieve bank helemaal zitten. En je hebt de ambitie om door te groeien naar een klantgerichte rol voor (groot)zakelijke klanten. Je wilt dan ook niets liever dan elke dag nieuwe facetten van het bankvak leren kennen en jezelf verder ontwikkelen tot zakelijk expert. At a glance

Digital bank robbers are getting smarter and smarter. Can you keep our data behind bars?
The need for information security is growing in a fast pace, especially within the banking sector, where there is much to be gained for cyber attackers. For this reason we are constantly looking for smarter ways to make digital banking as safe as possible. This is a key capability because there is a lot at stake.
The IT security wizards within our organization are the expert IT security advisors and monitors. As a wizard you help our colleagues designing and running secure applications in a DevOps environment.
Do you understand application security, are you able to provide expert advice, are you a good communicator that can bridge gaps and work in a team? Then we want you to join our team! We can provide you with excellent opportunities to further develop yourself, in a sector that is part of critical infrastructure, and as part of a larger team of great professionals to spar with.
Your job

You play a crucial role in securing our application landscape. You focus on our crown jewels, and ensure that security is constantly improving, amidst IT transformation such as our journey to the cloud, the implementation of DevOps and an Agile way of working. You contribute to the safety of the bank by securing individual applications, but also by looking at the bigger picture. You brainstorm, advise and work together with our talented development teams to ensure information security at the start of our banking products. Briefly: a constant co-creation and security by design!
ABN AMRO’s IT organization is your biggest client, which is an international environment with people from all over the world. You meet with your colleagues frequently, and sit in with start-ups. It is important to scale the business and customer interests against possible risks. If information security is at stake, you will have to step in and quickly come up with creative and smart alternatives. There is a range of technologies and external parties you will work with. Including the major cloud providers. This job provides you with the opportunity to work in a large diversity of tech, tech organizations, and colleagues.
Working environment

You will become part of CISO Technology and Engineering (T&E), which is part of Corporate Information Security Office (CISO). The CISO department consists of approx. 500 employees and works on the entire information security of the bank. T&E is a multinational team with over 90 employees. We focus on IT security and people security, and work with our IT-colleagues to ensure appropriate infrastructure and application security. In terms of hierarchy, there is little to be noticed as we work together in completing our tasks.
Working at ABN AMRO means: getting even better in what you do. We understand customers, translate their ambitions into common success and earn trust. We want our customers to understand our products. You understand the balance between technical security measures and potential organizational mitigating measures. A degree in Information Science or relevant studies

Broad knowledge of different IT and security capabilities and processes
Development life-cycle knowledge, e.g. secure SDLC and security by design
Experience with performing security assessments and with translating generic security requirements to specific cases
Cloud security with special focus on the Azure public cloud
Experience with IS documentation, -report writing, reviewing and consulting
Stakeholder management skills, especially in a multi-cultural and international environment
Core competencies in leading on content and within team, whilst being a team player

IT Security Wizard
At a glance

Digital bank robbers are getting smarter and smarter. Can you keep our data behind bars?
The need for information security is growing in a fast pace, especially within the banking sector, where there is much to be gained for cyber attackers. For this reason we are constantly looking for smarter ways to make digital banking as safe as possible. This is a key capability because there is a lot at stake.
The IT security wizards within our organization are the expert IT security advisors and monitors. As a wizard you help our colleagues designing and running secure applications in a DevOps environment.
Do you understand application security, are you able to provide expert advice, are you a good communicator that can bridge gaps and work in a team? Then we want you to join our team! We can provide you with excellent opportunities to further develop yourself, in a sector that is part of critical infrastructure, and as part of a larger team of great professionals to spar with.
Your job

You play a crucial role in securing our application landscape. You focus on our crown jewels, and ensure that security is constantly improving, amidst IT transformation such as our journey to the cloud, the implementation of DevOps and an Agile way of working. You contribute to the safety of the bank by securing individual applications, but also by looking at the bigger picture. You brainstorm, advise and work together with our talented development teams to ensure information security at the start of our banking products. Briefly: a constant co-creation and security by design!
ABN AMRO’s IT organization is your biggest client, which is an international environment with people from all over the world. You meet with your colleagues frequently, and sit in with start-ups. It is important to scale the business and customer interests against possible risks. If information security is at stake, you will have to step in and quickly come up with creative and smart alternatives. There is a range of technologies and external parties you will work with. Including the major cloud providers. This job provides you with the opportunity to work in a large diversity of tech, tech organizations, and colleagues.
Working environment

You will become part of CISO Technology and Engineering (T&E), which is part of Corporate Information Security Office (CISO). The CISO department consists of approx. 500 employees and works on the entire information security of the bank. T&E is a multinational team with over 90 employees. We focus on IT security and people security, and work with our IT-colleagues to ensure appropriate infrastructure and application security. In terms of hierarchy, there is little to be noticed as we work together in completing our tasks.
Working at ABN AMRO means: getting even better in what you do. We understand customers, translate their ambitions into common success and earn trust. We want our customers to understand our products. This means that we sometimes turn customers away if the risk of a product is great for them. Customer interest is also: providing a clear product range and communicating clearly. Banking is our profession, the world is our challenge. Moreover, we are socially involved and committed to the ABN AMRO Foundation. For instance, we contribute to giving Christmas presents to the less fortunate and we engage in charity walk.
Your profile

You are a senior (application) security specialist who is able to maintain a clear overview, can lead groups on content, and can present and communicate to management and larger groups of colleagues.
You are well acquainted with application security. You understand the balance between technical security measures and potential organizational mitigating measures. You continuously search for fresh ideas and gain more professional knowledge in order to enlarge your technical capabilities, as well as improving your soft skills. Furthermore, you have a sharp analytical eye and do not easily get stressed. In fact, you perform well under pressure.
You are bold, do not simply take things at face value, and dare to ask questions. You are able to entice colleagues with your ideas. This means you can easily convince people and transpose technical jargons into understandable language effortlessly. Sometimes you will only be given five minutes to substantiate your advice and solution. This should be enough to make your statement.

The chance to become even better as a security professional, by working in a critical sector and in a large team of likeminded professionals. Does IT security make your heart skip a beat? Then this role is for you! Our office in Amsterdam Southeast is your home base. We are also flexible, and working part of the week from home is the norm. ABN AMRO gives great importance to personal development and therefore offers a lot of training and career opportunities.
